_header: Laud of our Lord up to the heaven is raised
_description: John Lydgate, The Miracles of St. Edmund — one opening rhyme royal, and fifty-seven 8-line stanzas

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Laude of our lord vp to þe hevene is reysedabooff þe
                    sonne and briht sterris cleere…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…wolde interrupte his royal dygnytebe derogacyoun doon to his
                    ffraunchyse
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title: Here gynneth a myracle of Seynt Edmund (f. 42)

BodAsh46.First Lines:
Laude of our lord vp to the hevene is ReysedAbove the sonne and
                    bryght sterrys CleereAnd in his seyntes Our lord Ihesu is preysedAs
                    offte is seyn be ther devout prayeere…
BodAsh46.Last Lines:
…Wolde interupte his Royal digniteBe deregacioun doon to his
                    ffraunchyse
BodAsh46.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             Altenglische Legenden: Neue Folge.
         Heilbronn: Henninger, 1881: 440-5.

BodTan347.First Lines:
[L]Ande of our lord vp to hevene is reysedAbove the sonne and
                    bryght sterrys cleer…
BodTan347.Last Lines:
…Wolde Interupe his Royal digniteBy derogacioun doon to his
                    ffranchyse
BodTan347.Attributed Title:
A Requeste of the Translatour vn to seynt Edmond in Conservacioun of his
                    ffranchyse (preceding final stanza)
